message_1: In a school, 12 students participated in a debate competition. If each student is allowed to debate twice and every possible pair of students debated against each other once, how many debates were held in total?
message_2:
To find the total number of debates held, we can use the combination formula, which is C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!), where n is the total number of students and k is the size of the group (in this case, 2 students per debate).

So, we have C(12, 2) = 12! / (2!(12-2)!)

C(12, 2) = 12! / (2!10!)

C(12, 2) = (12 × 11 × 10!)/(2 × 10!)

C(12, 2) = (12 × 11)/(2)

C(12, 2) = 66

Since each student is allowed to debate twice, we multiply the result by 2:

Total debates = 66 × 2 = 132

So, there were 132 debates held in total.
